label: Decentralized Finance (DeFi)
description: Financial services that operate on blockchain technology without centralized intermediaries.

label: Decentralized Applications (dApps)
description: Applications that run on decentralized networks like blockchain, offering transparency and reduced reliance on centralized authorities.

label: Layer 1 Blockchains
description: Base blockchain networks, such as Ethereum and Bitcoin, providing the foundational protocol for decentralized applications and transactions.

label: Layer 2 Solutions
description: Scaling solutions built on top of Layer 1 blockchains to improve transaction speed and reduce costs.

label: Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs)
description: Unique digital assets that represent ownership of a specific item, artwork, or asset on the blockchain.

label: Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs)
description: Organizations governed by smart contracts and community votes, operating without centralized leadership.

label: Interoperability Protocols
description: Technologies that enable different blockchain networks to communicate and share data seamlessly.

label: Infrastructure Projects
description: Blockchain initiatives focused on providing the foundational tools and systems for the decentralized ecosystem.

label: Social Media Platforms
description: Decentralized social networks built on blockchain technology, offering enhanced privacy and user control over data.

label: Gaming Projects
description: Blockchain-based gaming platforms that incorporate play-to-earn mechanics, NFTs, and decentralized ownership.

label: Privacy-Focused Applications
description: Applications designed to prioritize user privacy and security, often utilizing cryptographic methods on the blockchain.

label: Stablecoins
description: Cryptocurrencies designed to maintain a stable value, often pegged to fiat currencies like the US Dollar.

label: Marketplaces for Digital Assets
description: Platforms enabling the buying, selling, and trading of digital assets like NFTs and cryptocurrencies.
